description.narrative: For supporting the We are the Solution (WAS) campaign, Grassroots Intl contributed to efforts to build a movement for food sovereignty in West Africa. It aimed to do this by empowering Rural Women's Associations (RWAs) to expand awareness of the campaign, the importance of agroecology to smallholder farmers, and the dangers that lie ahead – based on a communications strategy that the RWAs have developed and agreed in collaboration with Fahamu. The campaign focused particularly on supporting local level organizations to encourage their governments to subsidize organic agricultural inputs. The specific goals were to strengthen and expand WAS in all five participating West African countries by improving governance of the campaign, reinforcing participating RWA capacity, and increasing the connections between the RWAs; spread the message of WAS primarily through community radio campaigns with 200 short radio programs; and increase government support for agroecology.
